arm_group.description: All patients will receive the experimental agent eribulin.  The dose will increase with subsequent cohorts of patients.

brief_summary.textblock:
This is a study for children with cancer with no curative treatment options.  The
      investigators will be giving eribulin, a new chemotherapy agent, for the first time to
      children.  This study is designed to determine a safe dose the investigators can give to
      children in larger studies.  The investigators will be monitoring the children on this study
      for the safety of the treatment and levels of eribulin in the blood after treatment.  The
      investigators will also study the effect of the agent on the cancer.

clinical_study.brief_title: Study of Eribulin in Children With Cancer to Determine Safety

detailed_description.textblock:
This is a phase I study of eribulin, a novel tubulin inhibitor in children with relapsed and
      refractory solid tumors including lymphoma.  Dose escalation will be performed in a classic
      3+3 design starting with 75% of the adult maximum tolerated dose (MTD).  Pharmacokinetics
      will be done on each patient.  Primary endpoint will be the pediatric MTD.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Age: ≤ 21 years of age at the time of study enrollment

          -  Diagnosis: refractory   or   recurrent   solid   tumors,   including lymphomas,
             except those with CNS tumors or known CNS metastases

          -  Disease Status: measurable or evaluable disease

          -  Adequate organ function as defined in protocol

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Pregnant or breastfeeding

facility.name: Jimmy Everest Center for Cancer and Blood Disorders in Children

clinical_study.official_title: A Phase I Study of Eribulin, a Novel Microtubule Inhibitor, in Children With Refractory or Recurrent Solid Tumors

primary_outcome.description: The dose that does not cause dose limiting toxicity during the first cycle in more than 1 of 6 subjects

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: 13 blood samples will be drawn from each subject over first 8 days of protocol to measure serum levels of the agent eribulin.
secondary_outcome.measure: Pharmacokinetics of eribulin in children with cancer

secondary_outcome.description: Archival tumor samples from each subject will be stained for expression of BRCP and ABCB1, transporter proteins responsible for some resistance to chemotherapy.  Will compare expression and response data
secondary_outcome.measure: Tumor expression of BRCP and ABCB1

secondary_outcome.description: Subjects receiving eribulin will have scans approximately every 6 weeks to assess whether the tumors are growing, shrinking, or remaining stable.

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Non-Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Safety Study, Intervention Model: Single Group Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Treatment
